channel.title: I hope this counts as CAS
channel.description: This is a podcast made as a CAS project of three IB students. Here we are sharing our experiences in IB, discuss IAs, EEs, ToK and the general student life. We are also hosting a small Q&A section in the end.

image.title: I hope this counts as CAS

channel.itunes:summary: This is a podcast made as a CAS project of three IB students. Here we are sharing our experiences in IB, discuss IAs, EEs, ToK and the general student life. We are also hosting a small Q&A section in the end.
channel.itunes:author: Michael Mykhaylov

item.title: Episode 1 — Pilot
item.itunes:title: Episode 1 — Pilot
item.itunes:summary: Today we will be getting to know each other, as this is our first time talking. We also cover our experiences with the most hated subject of all — Theory of Knowledge. Inside are the tips how to make it more manageable.
item.description: Today we will be getting to know each other, as this is our first time talking. We also cover our experiences with the most hated subject of all — Theory of Knowledge. Inside are the tips how to make it more manageable.

item.title: Episode 2 — Getting through MOCKs, EEs and Group 4 Projects
item.itunes:title: Episode 2 — Getting through MOCKs, EEs and Group 4 Projects
item.itunes:summary: In this episode we tackle another bunch of the IBDP components, namely EEs and Group 4 Projects. We also mention the MOCK experience for the M21 students and answer the question many IB students might ask themselves: was it really worth it?
item.description: In this episode we tackle another bunch of the IBDP components, namely EEs and Group 4 Projects. We also mention the MOCK experience for the M21 students and answer the question many IB students might ask themselves: was it really worth it?

item.title: Episode 3 — COVID Situation and School Teachers
item.itunes:title: Episode 3 — COVID Situation and School Teachers
item.itunes:summary: In this episode we discus how the COVID affected all base elements of the IB program. We also share our experiences with our school teachers and the difficulties that arose from unqualification or miscommunication. Finally, we ponder about coming up with the theme of one of the most difficult IAs: math
item.description: In this episode we discus how the COVID affected all base elements of the IB program. We also share our experiences with our school teachers and the difficulties that arose from unqualification or miscommunication. Finally, we ponder about coming up with the theme of one of the most difficult IAs: math

item.title: Episode 4 — University applications and closures
item.itunes:title: Episode 4 — University applications and closures
item.itunes:summary: Well, this is it folks. Time to round things up. It has been a fun little CAS project of ours, and it sure did count as CAS. In this final episode we discuss the recent news and address our future, asking the question: where to next?
item.description: Well, this is it folks. Time to round things up. It has been a fun little CAS project of ours, and it sure did count as CAS. In this final episode we discuss the recent news and address our future, asking the question: where to next?
